channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dead tree, 24th September
item.description:
Dead tree on Ridley rd which was planted as part of the ridley rd upgrade; and now looks horrible.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ridley Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This graffiti is a disgrace. YOU - The City of London - need to do something about it, 24th September
item.description:
Don't just say "it's private land". Serve notice on the owners requiring them to clean it up. This is not the Bronx, it's the centre of the City.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9-10, St. Bride Street, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Like bike parked outside e-bike space, 24th September
item.description:
I watched the gentleman park his bike outside the designated space, when plenty of room was available. When I asked him to park it inside, I was promptly instructed to fuck off, then he ran off. The notional e-bike space is truly a gift to our community, serving our residents well. Thank you, Southwark Counci!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Boss Street, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime (and other) bikes blocking most of the pavement, 24th September
item.description:
The pavement on this corner is almost fully blocked by a number of e bikes (mainly Lime) that appear to have been deliberately placed there by the provider. This is far from the only case. These should either be placed in dedicated bays or not placed at all.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northumberland Avenue, Waterloo, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salusbury Road, London

item.title: Major cooking oil spill, 24th September
item.description:
Friday the 19th at 5:30 AM, a cooking oil collection company by the name of Olleco spilled an oil barrel on the pavement, destroying it, in front of Omi Lounge at 52 Wells Street. The pavement needs washing and the company needs to be fined.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Bywell Place, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing uncollected commercial waste bin, 24th September
item.description:
The commercial waste bin remains uncollected at the corner of Green Lanes and Melbourne Ave. It's now too full for the lid to close, so it is overflowing with rubbish and other contents spilling onto the road on Green Lanes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Melbourne Avenue, Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Matress left outside of property, 24th September
item.description:
Matress outside 42 Charlton Park Lane. It has been there for over a month presumably by the residents as it has not been removed. Also goal posts left on green outside. If the residents have left the matresstgen I hope they get fined otherwise they are getting their rubbish removed for free.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlton Park Lane, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish outside of number 6 Blenheim Terrace, 24th September
item.description:
Several large bags of rubbish left outside illegally have now created another giant mess on our street. Please start enforcing the laws. This is becoming a major nuisance. Problem are lovely street. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Ryder's Terrace, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose Pavings - Junction of Weston St. and St. Thomas' St., 24th September
item.description:
There are a couple of loose pavings near the junction of Weston St. and St. Thomas' St., SE1 (opposite the new sky scraper) that are a trip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Great Maze Pond, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerously Loose Pavings, 24th September
item.description:
One of the tactile paving on the pedestrian crossing outside Leon on Tooley Street (More London) is dangerously loose, and I tripped on it and fell on my face as I passed by on the evening of Saturday 13th September at approximately 18:27. (My mobile phone also went flying out of my hand, and was lucky not to have cracked as it had a protective cover.) It has been like this for a while now, and needs to be fixed ASAP before someone is seriously hurt. Several of the other narrow paving slabs in the More London area are also dangerously loose and I have tripped on them in the past also (I have also witnessed other people tripping on them).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tooley Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Pavement Defect (uneven surface / cracked paving slab)

item.title: Overhanging vegetation on route to school is affecting kids from Clare House school as they make their way along the footpath., 23rd September
item.description:
I walk this way with my kids twice a day and often have to step into the footpath to avoid others as we make our way past the over hanging trees and vegetation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakwood Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
